titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn, Jamaica and Flatbush Turnpike Company stockholder list 1978.177
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-22 15:32:10 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Brooklyn, Jamaica and Flatbush Turnpike Company stockholder list

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn, Jamaica, and Flatbush Turnpike Company

did.abstract: A undated typed copy of the original 1833 list of stockholders and the number of shares each purchased of the Brooklyn, Jamaica and Flatbush Turnpike Company.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of John Gemmill, date unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1978.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Brooklyn, Jamaica and Flatbush Turnpike Company was incorporated on March 17, 1809.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Brooklyn, Jamaica and Flatbush Turnpike Company stockholder list, undated copy of 1833 original, 1978.177, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A undated typed copy of the original 1833 list of stockholders and the number of shares each purchased of the Brooklyn, Jamaica and Flatbush Turnpike Company.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
